# UnitAcceleration

**Class**

A unit of measure for acceleration.

## Declaration

```swift
class UnitAcceleration
```

## Overview

You typically use instances of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitAcceleration] to represent specific quantities of acceleration using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] class.

### Acceleration

Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity. Acceleration can be expressed by SI derived units in terms of meters per second squared (m/s2).

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitAcceleration] class defines its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Dimension/baseUnit()] as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitAcceleration/metersPerSecondSquared], and provides the following units, which are initialized using [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConverterLinear] converters with the specified coefficients:



## Accessing the Base Unit

- **baseUnit()**: Returns the base unit.

## Accessing Predefined Units

- **metersPerSecondSquared**: Returns the meter per second squared unit of acceleration.
- **gravity**: Returns the gravity unit of acceleration.

## Time and Motion

- **UnitDuration**: A unit of measure for a duration of time.
- **UnitFrequency**: A unit of measure for frequency.
- **UnitSpeed**: A unit of measure for speed.
